Event.0: King Gaiseric & the Vandals sack Rome - Rome looted for 14 days
Event.1: American singer, songwriter, and guitarist Bo Diddley, who was one of the most influential performers of rock music's early period, died in Florida.
Event.2: Crime drama "The Wire" created by David Simon and starring Idris Elba and Dominic West debuts on HBO
Event.3: A jury in Denver, Colorado, found Timothy McVeigh of the militia movement guilty of murder and conspiracy in the deaths of 168 people in the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing, and he was executed in June 2001.
Event.4: 10,000 Chinese soldiers are blocked by 100,000 citizens in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, protecting students demonstrating for democracy
Event.5: Ray Charles' cover "I Just Can't Stop Loving You" from his influential crossover album "Modern Sounds in Country and Western Music" hits #1 on Billboard
Event.6:
Mani Ratnam
Indian filmmaker
was born
Event.7:
Elizabeth II crowned queen
On this day in 1953, 27-year-old Elizabeth II, the elder daughter of King George VI, was crowned queen of the United Kingdom at Westminster Abbey, having taken the throne upon her father's death in February 1952.
Event.8:
Cornel West
American philosopher and political activist
was born
Event.9: Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in Westminster Abbey, London, England
Event.10: In the aftermath of World War II, the people of Italy passed a referendum to replace the governing monarchy with a republic.
Event.11: American professional baseball player Lou Gehrig, who was nicknamed “the Iron Horse” for his record-setting number of consecutive games played, died in New York City, two years after being diagnosed with ALS.
Event.12: Constantine II, king of Greece from 1964 to 1974, was born in Psikhikó, near Athens.
Event.13: Babe Ruth, 40, announces his retirement as a player
Event.14:
Pete Conrad
American astronaut
was born
Event.15: Theoretical Physicist Albert Einstein (40) weds his cousin Elsa Lowenthal (43)
Event.16: Guglielmo Marconi applies to patent the radio, accepted 2 July 1897
Event.17: U.S. President Grover Cleveland (49) weds Frances Folsom (21), 1st presidential marriage to be held at the White House
Event.18: Frances Folsom, age 21, married U.S. President Grover Cleveland in the White House and became the youngest first lady in American history.
Event.19: Confederate soldiers yielded to Federal troops in Galveston, Texas, marking one of the final land operations of the American Civil War.
Event.20: Robert E. Lee takes command of Confederate armies of North Virginia during the American Civil War
Event.21: English novelist and poet Thomas Hardy, who set much of his work in Wessex, an imaginary county in southwestern England, was born.
Event.22:
Thomas Hardy
British writer
was born
Event.23: The Marquis de Sade, the French nobleman known for his erotic and perverse writings, was born in Paris.
Event.24:
Marquis de Sade
French author
was born
Event.25: Fulco V's son Godfried marries King Henry I's daughter Mathildis
